books.name: Superforecasting - The Art and Science of Prediction
books.author: Philip Tetlock
books.review: The preeminent book for anyone who has to make decisions in their life, personally or professionally (read: everyone). Will undoubtedly change the way you think about prediction.

books.name: Thinking Fast and Slow
books.author: Daniel Kahneman
books.review: At the toy store, a bat and ball cost $1.10 total. If the bat costs $1 more than the ball, how much does the ball cost?

books.name: Zen and the Art of Motorcycle Maitenance
books.author: Robert Pirsig
books.review: A book I desperately need to reread. For the linear/rational thinkers among us, we need to be reminded that life sometimes means getting your hands dirty.

books.name: Think Again
books.author: Adam Grant
books.review: This is basically 'A practical guide to a bayesian lifestyle', without Adam ever using the word Bayesian in the entire book.

books.name: MVP Machine
books.author: Travis Sawchick
books.review: The first revolution in baseball was finding undervalued players. The next one is taking players and making them better.

books.name: Range
books.author: David Epstein
books.review: A book that won't make you so bad for having one too many hobbies.

books.name: The Alchemist
books.author: Paolo Coehlo
books.review: A classic. We can all learn to be a bit more like Santiago and go in the direction that the universe pulls us.
